item.title: Disney Plus will launch November for $6.99
item.description: Story source: https://www.polygon.com/2019/4/11/17461766/disney-plus-price-release-date-shows-marvel-star-wars-pixar In the age of exclusive streaming services like HBO GO and CBS All Access sitting amongst streaming giants like Netflix or Hulu, it’s no surprise that the Walt Disney Company is putting together a streaming service of its own. Disney Plus will draw upon the brand’s vast reservoir of content, and finally, we know when it will launch: November 12, 2019. Disney Plus is being priced very aggressively — $6.

item.title: Disney+ Streaming Service Launches (Available Nov 12)
item.description: Story source: https://www.engadget.com/2019/04/11/disney-plus/ Content As we knew, Captain Marvel will be a streaming exclusive on Disney+ from day one, and the company said all of the Cars movies will be there also. Disney also showed off the Falcon & Winter Soldier spinoff show we’d heard about, and revealed a new show from Jeff Goldblum produced by National Geographic that’s in development. Frozen 2 will be a streaming exclusive by the time it comes home next, and the first one, along with the rest of Disney’s Signature movies will be streaming on day one.

item.title: GE Aviation and the Ceramic Matrix Composite Revolution
item.description: Story source: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=is1BBilkyUM GE Aviation is creating adjacent factories in Huntsville, Alabama, to mass- produce silicon carbide (SiC) materials used to manufacture ceramic matrix composite components (CMCs) for jet engines and land-based gas turbines. For more than 20 years, scientists at GE’s Global Research Centers and GE’s industrial businesses have worked to develop CMCs. In recent years, GE Aviation has made significant strides in advancing CMCs for jet propulsion. Learn how GE is bringing the future of flight to today¹s aircraft when you subscribe to the GE Aviation Channel at youtube.

item.title: Gaia Hypothesis
item.description:
Story source: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gaia_hypothesis Hypothesis that living organisms interact with their surroundings in a self- regulating system
The study of planetary habitability is partly based upon extrapolation from knowledge of the Earth ’s conditions, as the Earth is the only planet currently known to harbour life. The Gaia hypothesis ( , , ), also known as the Gaia theory or the Gaia principle , proposes that living organisms interact with their inorganic surroundings on Earth to form a synergistic and self-regulating, complex system that helps to maintain and perpetuate the conditions for life on the planet.

item.description: Story source: https://hackernoon.com/in-the-digital-age-cognitive-biases-are-running-wild-420b8f4f7cb5 How the Internet Amplifies Our Cognitive Biases Photo by jesse orrico on Unsplash Here are three strange ways the human mind works: If a person with a certain strong belief is presented with clear evidence of the belief being false, this may lead to a reinforcement of the belief. item.title: McDonald's in Taiwan to stop providing plastic straws by July
item.description: Story source: http://focustaiwan.tw/news/asoc/201904110018.aspx Photo for illustrative purposes only / CNA file photo Taipei, April 11 (CNA) Fast food company McDonald’s said Thursday that it will no longer offer plastic straws at its restaurants in Taiwan, with effect from July, in accordance with a government initiative to reduce the use of plastic. At a press conference, the company said it is phasing in the new plan, starting Friday, by not proactively offering plastic straws at its checkout counters, the company said.
